website_summaries.verdict: A fixed broadhead that is expertly crafted for amazing durability.
pros: Constructed from stainless steel for outstanding quality
Broadhead is 100% spin tested to ensure it will fly straight and hit accurately at all times
Includes 3 fixed razor-sharp blades that can be resharpened as needed
Comes with a screw-in design for easy installation
cons: May need to sharpen the broadhead right away following initial purchase
Sometimes can be tough to sharpen the blades

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great! The one on the right is the real deal, the one on the left is this savage broadhead. overall it's actually slightly larger than the real deal, by almost an 1/8" overall. it is not AS sharp but plenty sharp enough and easily sharpened if you feel the need to. i cannot attest as to the durability but I suspect it will be up to par. weight was good at an average of +-2 grains of 100 (they all were within 98-102 grains), they seemed to shoot well and group fine, for the money, you cant beat them!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: economical, very close to Montecs, all had consistent weight and flew well, good penetration (on target) Cons: came wrapped in foam sheet and tape in a cardboard box, no sharpened well (needed a bit more sharpening/honing to get them shave sharp) These flew well, hit well and once they were sharpened had better than expected penetration.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Like Field Tips
customer_reviews.text: Whoa, these things are amazing. They look like g5 montecs. I was worried when I purchased these for cheap. I went out and shot them, they fly really well. They actually kept up in penetration with slick tricks and magnus buzzcuts. I had to sharpen them on a stone before shooting, they came fairly dull. I may actually use these for mule deer and the magnus for elk. They are a great inexpensive option. I have only shot out to 50 yards with these, so take that for what it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle R Broadhead

customer_reviews.title: This makes me "almost" feel sorry for the high price competitors!
customer_reviews.text: Took about 8 passes per side (×3) across 400 grit sand paper to give these broadheads a deadly sharp finish. Anyone who complains about the difficulty of sharpening these are people who should not be hunting!!! Weighed in a little over spec but all were equal and very close to spec after sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: Dev M.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than you would expect
customer_reviews.text: They might be small but they are reasonably sharp. They are not sharp as a razor if your wondering but I have hunter deer and rabbit with them worked fine no problems. I tried sharpening them it made them more dull I would leave them as they are and use. although if your an expert sharpener you owe it to the animal to make them as sharp as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Maysara Abdo

customer_reviews.title: Needs TLC
customer_reviews.text: Nice and cheap. It comes dull and unsharpen, so had to put in some elbow grease to sharpen it up. Some time for six broadheads.
customer_reviews.author: King Seal

customer_reviews.title: Value/Practice
customer_reviews.text: Weighed them all, most in the range of 85-90 grams with one or two that were low 80s. Patterned them, after switching them around between shafts to make them all as consistent as I could. A little noise from them but overall for the price nice pieces. I did feel the need to clean up the edges with a small stone.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hall

customer_reviews.title: Worth it and then some!!
customer_reviews.text: We have always used montek broad heads. But I found these, cheaper and more. The quality seems to be just as good! Husband killed a deer this evening and he used the same broad head twice and it's still in good condition. Could probably use a resharpen, but no Knicks in the blades.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Dull, damaged, and not suitable for hunting!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a set of 12, thinking I would practice with six and keep six to elk hunt with. Every broadhead has at least 2 of the three cutting edges either rolled over or otherwise damaged. I'm going to try sharpening them, but don't know if they are worth the effort. I doubt if these are a high carbon stainless steel capable of holding an edge. They slide right across my thumbnail indicating they are not sharp!
customer_reviews.author: customcutter

customer_reviews.title: Good for Whitetail
customer_reviews.text: Used these the last 2 years. Love the love, like their penetration. As long as theyre sharp, you're good to go with these. Ive had to resharpen a few times in the blind, but thats more because we didnt get to see as many deer as we'd hope. SO it was a lot of taking the arrow out, putting the arrow back in the quiver. Id order them again.
customer_reviews.author: FFMooch

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Balanced well same weight as the name brand in the stores but you get 5 for $15 instead of 3 for $45. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Brown

customer_reviews.title: Weird flight path
customer_reviews.text: Although I knew these weren't the real deal, I didn't know they would create a flight problem. Every one of these flys left of my target. I can't figure why except to say each weighs a little bit different. They do hold an edge well enough and I imagine they will help my wife find them in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: william jennings

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: these broadheads are crooked, different shaped and nowhere near strong enough to use for hunting. I bought them just to test out and was horribly disappointed, They had different cutting diameters throughout the dozen and most would not pass a spin test. there were even missing chunks on some of them from their casting process. Just plain garbage and don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Should have read the other reviews....
customer_reviews.text: The broadheads showed up quickly but were soon to disappoint. These are purple , not hot pink like in the pictures or description. Also came very full, will take hours to hone and sharpen
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, as expected, very very dull
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap, and the price reflects it. We had to sharpen them ourselves. They are also labled pink but are clesrly more purple when they arrive. They come loose very easily. Not just loose, but multiples complete twists loose. I'll skip these and go back to Rage the rest of the season and next. Not worth trying to save some money
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn S.

customer_reviews.title: They are a little dull, but they fly very well and seem to ...
customer_reviews.text: Got these in the mail a few days ago. Shipping was quick. They fly true. They are a little dull, but they fly very well and seem to be pretty tough. I will be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Avonlea Harder

customer_reviews.title: Good broadheads
customer_reviews.text: Good broadheads. Fly like field points. They were what our of the box but not enough for me. I touched then up with a mill file a a fine diamond stone. Took less than 5 minutes each and they were like serrated razors!
customer_reviews.author: C. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value if you have time!
customer_reviews.text: These are great broad-heads for the money my wife killed an antelope with one and i a bull elk. With that being said they MUST BE SHARPENED BEFORE USE! They are knock offs Montecs G5 and NAPS hellrazor. I sharpened them up which honestly was a pain in the ass but afterward they performed as well as my G5’s
customer_reviews.author: Bnorc

customer_reviews.title: They aren't brand name but they do a great job
customer_reviews.text: I haven't bought montecs for quite awhile now these are good broadheads now my wife uses them for practice and hunting they sharpen real easy and are solid
customer_reviews.author: steve houston

customer_reviews.title: Sharpen them!
customer_reviews.text: These broadheads were in good working condition however the blades were as sharp as a spoon edge, but they are easily shapened.
customer_reviews.author: Nezbelthar

customer_reviews.title: Not a "CHEAP" knockoff by any means!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Very nice broadheads for the money. They will cut right out of the package, BUT, it wouldn't hurt to sharpen them. I'm shooting the Killer Instinct Ripper 415 with the Carbon Express Pyle driver bolts and these broadheads on with this combo are Dead On Target. I can't wait until he season to try them out!
customer_reviews.author: G.S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: Made of good materials. But can not tune to my arrows. They are not true or something. They wobble.
customer_reviews.author: alvin biggs

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough. Not a g5 substitute though.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp initially. Not very durable. Dodnt hone up on the stone like a montec. It'll do the job, but if you want a broadhead that will last until you lose it, buy the montec.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great value...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much what I was hoping for. Definitely needed a little sharpening, but they fly great and they save me a lot of money. Well worth it. Only four stars because they are slightly off in weight. 10 weighed in at 103gr and the other two were 104.5. No biggy, they’ll still kill a deer easily.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Luttmann

customer_reviews.title: Nice for price
customer_reviews.text: These fly nice but are dull when you receive them so plan on doing some sharpening. Also they are sold as a 6 pack not a 5 pack.
customer_reviews.author: JayG

customer_reviews.title: Must sharpen right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Similar to g5 broadheads but slightly larger. Came dull... But sharpened easily on a whetstone.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Needs to sharpening out of the package but fly true with little drag. Sharpening these up for hunting season and saving a ton.
customer_reviews.author: C. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used for a hog hunt works great very similar to my g5 montecs
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Do the job from a much more affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: Product is good quality. Price is much more affordable an G5 broad heads. Could be shaper than they are. I just sharpened them after I received them. Will purchase again👍
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 110 not 100 grain
customer_reviews.text: All 110 +- 1 grain, when advertised as 100, relatively dull due to fat blades, though decent design, not the highest quality steel, but you get what you pay for. (The broadhead I’m reviewing is on the right, comparing to another broadhead on the left purchased elsewhere)
customer_reviews.author: Ben H.

customer_reviews.title: Saved $100 bucks.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to see if they held up like the $40 for 3 Montecs I currently use. Other than needing a good sharpening, I can not tell difference. Good quality steel so sharpening was bit of a job but well worth the time once done. Felt and flew like target tips
customer_reviews.author: Mark Slaight

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: These will need touched up. Seem a little chincy. Work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: They shipped fast and are just as good as the G5. I'm not sure why people are saying they are full because I've ordered these twice and they have all came sharp. No complaints from me
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline McElfish

customer_reviews.title: Pink
customer_reviews.text: Pink was cheaper and they still get the job done!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Two of them were undersized and would not thread. Quality is very weak. Let my 5 year old son shoot them at a milk jug full of water. Only pierced one side and completely warped the head.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Colvin

customer_reviews.title: Super price super quality
customer_reviews.text: great quality very durable perfect fit on my crossbow bolts very sharp
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs sharpened upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: They came in with very dull edges. But after a little work on a belt sander and a hone I believe I can hunt with them.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D Monnett

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good practice point for the real ones
customer_reviews.text: Side-by-side their identicle enough to the real ones. I think there best used as a Practice point
customer_reviews.author: Trocar

customer_reviews.title: They are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Yep, using them as practice points for the real ones. They are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Scottymac

customer_reviews.title: Dull
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to get the most for my buck, well I got the least for my buck. These broad head were duller than a butter knife. Do not recommend if you want a clean shot to take down the animal ethically.
customer_reviews.author: Myriah

customer_reviews.title: not the case with my order out of the package razor sharp fly just like my field points very happy with
customer_reviews.text: I keep seeing people needed to sharpen these ...not the case with my order out of the package razor sharp fly just like my field points very happy with them
customer_reviews.author: skwirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Broadhead
customer_reviews.text: The broad head had good flight, just a bit low with my bow setup. The heads needed to be sharpened a bit but overall not bad. The image shown is a 38 yard shot with a clean pass through and recovery with within 40 yards.
customer_reviews.author: C. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, bone crushing
customer_reviews.text: I broke right therw a deers shoulder ,it preformed like a montec for have the price fly's consistent ,out of my 400 it's cossbow.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Point of impact changed dramatically. It was like a curve ball . I put my Allen's back on-their consistant.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Awesome +5
customer_reviews.text: Perfect broadheads! Shoot straight and true! Aweomse performance weight was dead even 100gr per broadhead. Had to sharpen them straight out of the box but well worth the money can’t tell a difference in these and my G5 Montecs except for the Price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex s.

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp out of the box, will need an edge put on them.
customer_reviews.text: Not as rugged as I expected and were not sharp out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Found them equivalent to G5
customer_reviews.text: These are great. instead of paying $40 for 3 Broad heads for Montecs
customer_reviews.author: Hunting user

customer_reviews.title: Not get complete order that was purchased
customer_reviews.text: Only got six broad heads when the purchase was for 12
customer_reviews.author: mzruyohycbokoi

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly refined
customer_reviews.text: My opinion these are good for back ups or practice . Have a picture montecs on top to compare.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar crazy horse

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Received package with 1 missing on arrival. Otherwise item appears as described.
customer_reviews.author: shawn smith

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏹🦌
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for practice and sighting in. I’m using the g5 montec for hunting. Figure these were fairly close in weight and style. Not very sharp. Didn’t spend much time tryin fo sharpen yet but they started taking an edge when I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these, not even for practice!
customer_reviews.text: If one of your employees did in fact spin test these broadheads. Then fire that employee, please!!!! 1 of the 6 spins true. I bought these to practice/mess around with, because I don't want to ruin my G5's. If you're in the market for broadheads to hunt with. Do yourself a favor and get the real thing. These are a waste of steel.
customer_reviews.author: Chels

customer_reviews.title: Missing part of order.😠
customer_reviews.text: Got my broadhead in the mail today, and I'm not to happy. As for the broadhead they are ok, some are plenty sharp others look like crap. I ordered 12 and got 10, packing was well none. The heads have bounced around in the box they came in leaving some with chips in the heads. These will work and will be great after sharpened.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: looks to be good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be good quality. Needs to be sharpened before use (?) but still would do the job as they come.
customer_reviews.author: EBD

customer_reviews.title: not as good a others maded in the
customer_reviews.text: Ok performance for heads made in China..not as good a others maded in the USA
customer_reviews.author: C D

customer_reviews.title: even on some not so good shots just sharpen them a touch and hunt away
customer_reviews.text: Strong heads,,not so sharp but they will do the job. even on some not so good shots just sharpen them a touch and hunt away. ..
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Will never hunt with it, takes people for a ride
customer_reviews.text: Will never hunt with it, takes people for a ride
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Would be 5 star but they said they would be here two days ago. Just shot them and from 25 and 35 they are right on target. Look like good quality that could be resharpened but field test to come soon. Will update when able. Good product so far
customer_reviews.author: foxf08

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: These are not bad at all. Yes they could be sharper but other than that, they are very nice and will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Seethus

product_meta.title: Savage Village Hunting Broadhead 100 Grain Fixed Blades Stainless Steel, for Crossbow Recurve Bow Compound Bow, Archery Broadhead
feature_bullets: 100% spin testing to make sure fly straight and hit accurately
Precision weight: 100 grain +/- 1 grain, Cutting diameter:1”~ 1 1/8”
3 fixed razor sharp blades, can be resharpened
If you are not satisfied with our broadhead, we provide full refund guarantee within 30 days

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
